intro: Crotalaria meeboldii, commonly known as the yellow rattle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its seeds are encased in a hard, dry pod that splits open when mature to release the seeds. The plant is often found in grassy areas and is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil.
